1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: When Taichi Hashimoto sees a girl standing on top of the school building, he fears that she may attempt suicide and races to save her. He finds a free-spirited and lively girl, Mioka, and is instantly drawn to her. What he doesn't know is that she is dying from an incurable and degenerative brain disease.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Taichi is invited to a concert by Mari. Mari confides to Mioka that she loves Taichi. When Mioka collapses, Taichi rushes to hospital with her and realizes that he has fallen in love with her. After recovering, Mioka explains her illness to Taichi.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Mioka and her parents make a final visit to her grandmother. Taichi confesses his feelings for Mioka to Mari.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: The symptoms from Mioka's illness start to intensify. Mioka meets the Hashimoto family. Taichi and Mioka ask her parents to approve of their relationship. Their friends start to sense that Taichi and Mioka are guarding a secret.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: When out with Taichi and their friends, Mioka collapses and is hospitalized. Mari suspects the severity of Mioka's illness. Both sets of parents disapprove of the lovers' plans to live together and make their feelings on the subject known.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Mioka and Taichi start to look for an apartment together. A chance meeting with a despondent girl at the seaside reveals the terrible truth of Mioka's illness to their friends.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Just as Taichi and Mioka set off to attend a rock festival, physical symptoms of Mioka's illness start to show. Once again hospitalized, Mioka faces her grim future. Dr. Takanashi allows her to leave after two days, but Dr. Ikegami is most displeased by this.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: Mioka's physical symptoms are worsening. Her parents take her and Taichi on a brief family holiday. Dr. Takanashi suggests to Mioka's parents that it is almost time to hospitalize her. As she loses control over her own body, Mioka herself realizes that she and Taichi can no longer cope.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Her body and mind failing, Mioka is hospitalized once more, for the penultimate time. Dr. Takanashi allows her one final day out of hospital, into the care of Taichi, her parents, and her friends. Upon her return to hospital, Mioka uses her phone to record a message for Taichi.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Mioka slips into unconsciousness and, when she awakens, she recognizes nobody. With the dedicated attention of her parents and Taichi, she briefly regains her memories. She passes her recorded message to Taichi. This brief period of lucidity helps Mioka's loved ones to cope with their grief.

imdb.plot outline: One day, Taichi, an ordinary university student meets Mioka, a girl who is like a storm. Taichi finds himself drawn to Mioka, who lives freely as she wishes without holding back, and they eventually fall in love. However, Mioka tells Taichi of her shocking truth. She has an incurable brain disease, with no medicine or treatment that can help her. The progressing disease. The loss of control over her own body. Theprecious memories slowly fading away. The fear of losing herself. The limited time she has left. Even with such a cruel fate, Mioka lives her life to the fullest extent till the end. Taichi, wholeheartedly loving her, decides to become the witness of her very existence in this world.
